title: Domain 3.3: Compare and contrast concepts and strategies to protect data.
content:
🗂️ Data Types

  • ⚖️ Regulated: Controlled by laws or standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR, PCI-DSS).
  • 🕵️ Trade Secret: Proprietary info like formulas or processes.
  • 🧠 Intellectual Property (IP): Creative works protected by copyright, trademarks, or patents.
  • 📜 Legal Information: Contracts, court filings, legal records.
  • 💳 Financial Information: Credit card numbers, banking info, payroll—often targeted.
  • 🤖 Human-Readable vs. Non-Human-Readable:
    • Human-readable: Text, PDFs, emails.
    • Non-human-readable: Encrypted files, binaries.

🔒 Data Classifications

  • 🟡 Sensitive: Exposure could cause harm (e.g., employee records).
  • 🔴 Confidential: High-risk data (e.g., medical, strategic info).
  • 🌐 Public: No access restrictions (e.g., press releases).
  • 🔐 Restricted: Access limited by role or clearance.
  • 🕶️ Private: Non-public organizational or personal data.
  • 🚨 Critical: Essential to business operations.

🧠 General Data Considerations

  • 📦 Data States:
    • 🛑 At Rest: Stored data—encrypt and restrict access.
    • ✈️ In Transit: Moving data—protect with TLS, VPN, or IPSec.
    • ⚙️ In Use: Being processed—protect RAM and endpoints.
  • 🌍 Data Sovereignty: Data follows the laws of the country it’s stored in.
  • 📌 Geolocation: Ties data access to physical regions for legal or security reasons.

🛡️ Methods to Secure Data

  • 🌐 Geographic Restrictions: Limit access from risky or restricted regions.
  • 🔐 Encryption: Secure all data states with strong encryption.
  • 🔁 Hashing: Verify integrity (one-way, non-reversible).
  • 🎭 Masking: Hide real data with realistic fake values.
  • 🪪 Tokenization: Replace data with tokens, store real data securely elsewhere.
  • 🕵️ Obfuscation: Scrambles or hides meaning—useful for code/config security.
  • 🧱 Segmentation: Limits breach impact by isolating systems or datasets.
  • 🚫 Permission Restrictions: Control who can access/modify/view data.
